intro: Galium araucanum, commonly known as the Araucanian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Galium araucanum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
